It's a sad truth that in life, not everyone can start off equal. While there are various factors that can come into play, a very simple one is your upbringing. Every child is brought up in a different environment, different backgrounds along with different people. There's no doubt that a child brought up in a middle class family in a first world country is going to have a significantly more pleasant childhood than a child in a working class family in a second world country. It is one of the many parts of life that one must come to terms with, as one cannot choose their own fate.

However, fate appeared to shine on the girl in focus. This girl is Lilly Satou. A very lucky girl indeed, this child was brought up with a very loving family, having two caring parents bringing her up along with her older sister by the name of Akira. Despite their vast differences, the two girls both loved each other so. To add to this, both parents to young Lilly were most successful. Her father owned a worldwide business, his fortunes and wealth constantly growing due to the workforce he headed. Her mother was also successful in her own right, while not owning a massive company she still had a relatively high paying job. This large amount of income from both sides meant that Lilly along with her family could live in the lap of luxury, with any of her desires able to be granted.

Though, not everything was so great for Lilly. Ever since her birth, Lilly had been completely blind, her eyes simply refusing to work. This made her early life difficult to adapt to, as both her and her family needed to learn and adapt to the condition bestowed upon her. Many different methods were brought in to assist with Lilly, as she initially having a guide dog for a while. Over time, as she learnt to handle her blindness on her own as she grew older, she gave her guide dog up and went for the more traditional cane, which she continued for many years after.

Despite all this, Lilly remained a proper girl. In a strange case, she was a 50/50 split of Japanese and Scottish, her father hailing from Inverness while her mother came from Akita. Getting her senses back, she had just run into someone and landed right on her plush butt. Opening her eyes, she saw someone she recognized in a similar state.

"Oh Hisao, sorry for bumping into you like that." she said, still feeling the dull pain in her forehead.

"Ah don't worry it's my fault." said Hisao as he stood up and offered a hand to the bubbly girl. Taking it, an idea hatched in that pretty little head of hers. As she was lifted, she took the papers in her hand and glanced at them. There was only a few signatures compared to the dozens that she needed to collect.

"Say Hisao, are you busy right now?" she asked, trying to make her voice as sweet as possible. Hisao considered himself to be somewhat good at reading people, and his mind was telling him that Misha was asking for a favor.

"Not particularly, is there anything I can help you out with?' he asked. Luckily for Misha, Hisao was also the type of guy to help out his friends whenever he could.

"Yup in fact you'd be doing me a super huge favor if you did." said Misha as she began to explain the situation. Understanding, she gave Hisao half of her stack and sent him off in the other direction. As she restarted her duty, she wore a bright smile.

After a good hour of scribbling and rushing about, Misha had finished her stack and was resting on one of the benches outside, her body slumped down with her eyes lazily drooping down, the paperwork haven given her quite a tough time due to the running around she's needed to do. Her eyes widened as she saw Hisao returning past her with the full stack in his hands, notably much more alert and active than Misha after doing the paperwork.

"And there you are Misha, every signature filled out. Was pretty annoying to track everyone down, but I got there." He took a long look at Misha's tired expression. "Good thing I was here to help you, huh?"

"You think?" Misha replied breathlessly, getting up from the bench and stretching herself out. "It'd say it's time I upheld my side of this deal! You've done something for me, so it's only fitting I do something for you in return~!"

"Oh, there's no need, I was only he-"

Before he could finish his decline, Hisao found himself grabbed by the arm and dragged quite harshly by the arm by Misha, the bubblegum haired girl having amazing strength for someone who was still breathing raggedly.

"No, I insist you come so I can reward you~!" She said, a surprising sharpness in her voice. Trying his best to keep up with her pace, Hisao was soon dragged out of the school all the way to the usual watering hole for many of the students of the school, including Misha, the Shanghai.

"You're getting a reward if it's the last thing I do! Now order up, it's all on me!" Misha announced as she sat down at one of the free tables, Hisao doing so himself as a waitress (Somewhat to his dismay not Yuuko) took Misha's order.

"Wait, you're getting something yourself? What about this being my reward?"

She rolled her eyes at him, though in a jestful manner. "Hey, I did a bunch of work too! You expect me to finish off a workload on an empty stomach~?"

Chuckling at her reasoning and shaking his head a little, Hisao ordered his own share, to which Misha handed over some money to the waitress. However, some words were exchanged between the two of them, these words causing her smile to turn into an upset frown.

"Is something the matter?" Hisao asked the now saddened girl.

"Yeah! I'm a little short and it means I can't have extra cream on my Parfait!" Misha replied, a slight whining tone in her voice.

"You know, I could just take something out of my order Misha. It'll be much eas-"

"What?! No!" She interrupted him with her shriek. "That would defeat the purpose of bringing you here! I want to treat you for helping me, but a Parfait isn't the same without cream...."

Hisao looked the wobbling dejected eyes on Misha's face, her lip quivering slightly as the waitress stood there with money in hand and a slightly annoyed look on her face.

Not being one to reject such a cute girl, Hisao looked into his own wallet and knew that he would have enough to cover the sweet girl's sweet treat. Placing a few of the bills into the waitresses' hand, she gladly took it and left the pair alone. Looking back at Misha, she had a large smile on her face and Hisao felt a slight ping in his chest. Was he getting too excited?

"Thanks a lot Hisao! Now you've made Misha's nice list!" exclaimed the pink haired girl as she eagerly awaited her sweet meal. Deciding to play along a bit, Hisao asked her about this so called 'nice list' was.

"Oh? Nice list?" he asked with a tone that showed interest. Misha gave her trademarked laugh as she humored the young man.

"Wahaha, that means that you get to treat me to stuff like ice cream, cakes and all of that sweet stuff whenever I want. Doesn't that sound like a good deal?" she asked with a smile still plastered on his face.

"Well it does sound tempting." said Hisao with a smirk on his face as well. The two went back and forth like this for a bit of time, their conversation eventually dialing down to simple conversation like favorite movies, types of music you listen to, opinions on the school and such. If someone were to just come across the pair, they would have easily mistaken them as a new couple out on a date. Eventually the waitress returned with the food, Hisao getting a hearty roast beef sandwich with a few strips of bacon and a soda with Misha getting a sweet strawberry cheesecake and her precious parfait with a nice amount of whipped cream on top. Eagerly digging through her cheesecake, Hisao also began to eat his meal, finding his sandwich very tasty. Soon, she was done with her cheesecake and went right for her parfait. It was also strawberry oriented, with strawberry creme, sliced strawberries and even a strawberry flavored sugar straw. As she ate, Hisao noticed she got a bit of whipped cream on her cheek.

"Ah Misha, you got a bit right here." said Hisao as he pointed towards his cheek. Giving off a slight red blush, she quickly wiped the area with a napkin and gave him a sincere smile.

"Heehee, thanks Hisao." was all that she said as she continued her assault on the treat. Seeing her smile like that, he felt another pang in his chest. However, it wasn't painful, in fact, it made him feel a bit warm inside.

Though the school had been rather busy due to the upcoming festival preparations, it didn't do much to brighten up the day for Hisao, as it usually just meant having to wade through masses of people working left and right to set up stock and stands for the big day.

That is, until he say a beacon of joy in a sea of people. From far away he spotted the trademark pink hair of a certain bubbly girl ploughing her way through the masses of people, pushing by as best as she could so to find Hisao. When she eventually did, she near stormed over to him with little regard for others, seemingly determined to find him.

Waving a hand over, Hisao took note of how her other hand was currently holding onto various supplies of wood, elongated and worn with a hammer between her fingers. Whilst mentally he questioned how safe it was for her to carry so much like that in a crowed area, seemingly no one was hurt so it all checked out.

"Hey, Hisao! Man, am I glad to see you!" Misha was very breathless as she usually was when working hard, switching the piles of wood from one hand into the other, using the newly free hand to shake it as a way of releasing pain. "I need another favour if you don't mind me asking! I've got to repair all the old stands around but there's so many around it's hard to single the older ones out!" She clasped her hands together and fluttered her eyelashes. "Care to help out a poor wittle girl in need?"

She gave her brightest and toothiest grin as she pass a stack of planks over to Hisao and a spare hammer before rushing off into the opposite direction to him. Hisao chuckled as she when running, finding himself starting to like spending time with the student council lackey.

"Why are you staring at me Misha?" Hisao asked, only in curiosity and not in any annoyance.

Here he was, sitting alongside the infamous Misha of Yamaku Academy and having yet another lunch with her. Right now, Hisao didn't really know what to think of her, she was mischievous, she was bubbly and she was incredibly nice if you didn't anger her. Still there was something about her that continued to draw him to her during these past few day, something he couldn't really place.

"Heh, guess they're pretty busy today." said Hisao, looking around to see that the cafe was packed with various customers and waitresses walking all about.

"Wahaha~ Maybe we should have tried somewhere else." laughed Misha using her trademarked laugh, her 'drills' bouncing along with the action. So as Hisao was naturally curious, he thought asking about the upcoming festival would be a good way to pass the time until their food came. All he knew is that there were a number of clubs and even some outside school businesses were involved. He also knew that there were a lot of stalls and events planned.

"So Misha, can you tell me more about this school festival? What with me being new to the school and all." said Hisao, taking a sip from the complementary glass of water.

"Ah, that's right, you're a newbie aren't ya?" said Misha, her laugh breaking any sign of silence.

"Forgive me for being so green." smirked Hisao.

"Well the festival is one of the school's most highly anticipated events. The more that Misha went on and on about it, the more that Hisao was becoming more interested in it.

"Huh, that all sounds great." At his words, Misha's expression fell slightly, causing him a bit of concern.

However, there was no way he could ignore Misha, who was looking incredibly defeated right now.

After some waiting, Misha's hungry eyes stared upon the large Parfait that was placed before her, which was accompanied by a few slices of cheesecake and a plate of miniature cookies. Hisao's own meal, a bowl of meat casserole with a selection of diced vegetables, was placed down, paling in comparison to Misha's oversized order.

"Heh, it's a good thing you're paying for me and not the other way around." Hisao joked as Misha dug into the top of her Parfait with her spoon, smiling as she gulped down several helpings of the cream topping.

"Well, what can I say? The Shanghai knows how to make good food!" Misha enjoyed a forkful of cheesecake in the middle of her speech. "I could guarantee you that the profits would drop drastically if I stopped eating here!" She gave on her trademark "Wahaha~"s before eating once more, to which the two of them began to eat their meals. Hisao glanced up occasionally, noticing the speed of Misha's eating was much faster than his in comparison.

Halfway through the meal, he heard a shrill cry from next to him, causing a few heads to turn in the direction of Misha. She was gripping a menu with both hands. "What's up Misha?" Hisao asked with a questioning tone.

"It's awful Hisao! There's a new Parfait in the store and I didn't see it! I spent all my lunch yen on this!" She looked like she was genuinely going to cry. Oh it's awful awful aw-"

For the most part, everything was shaping up nicely. The stands were almost fully set up, cooking stations tested and running, the athletic grounds were in great condition for the sports activities, even the school's mural was finished on time despite the inherent laziness of it's artist. Given how he has leant his services to the festival, Hisao was busy getting supplies sorted out, getting all manner of necessary provisions to those who needed it. He knew Misha would be around here somewhere, and he knew she would no doubt need a pick me up. She wasn't the kind of girl who could keep working for prolonged times without getting some rest.

She wasn't too hard to spot, Misha's bubblegum hair a beacon amidst brown boxes as she was resting atop a stack, arms folded as her head rest on them, panting heavily. She looked very flushed and rather tired, had she been up early and working non-stop? Regardless, Hisao walked over to greet her, to which he saw her face go from exhaustion to pure joy as she saw him.

"Hicchan!" She called out, walking forward and giving him a very large hug, very pleased to see him. "Oh I missed you, I assumed you were working off the school grounds buying the supplies!" Holding onto his hands, Misha could barely contain her excitement, her face grinning widely.

"Well I'm here now!" Hisao replied, laughing slightly. "Looks like you could use something to perk yourself up, if you wouldn't mind me treating a young lady..."

This only made Misha giggle, getting herself lost in a fit of laughing. Hisao simply assumed this was a yes, getting from one of the boxes a still cold tub of ice cream, only recently taken from storage. Pinching a spoon from a nearby kitchen stand, he gave it to Misha as she dug into the food, very pleased she had something to eat.

"Mmmm~ Thank you Hicchan, you're a true gentleman you are!" Misha beamed as she continued to eat. "Only thing to make this better would be some more exotic food! Man, is vanilla all they have here?" She noted between mouthfuls.

Misha was less listening and more salivating at the foods, but she soon went back to her senses. "Uh, yeah! That would be delicious...and good!"

"Right then, we best write these down and get them to the cookery club. Hope they don't mind the extra work." Hisao added, before the two of them went back to sitting together, Misha hungrily eating away. Looking over at her, Hisao noticed her blouse looked a little tight on her, a clear outline of her stomach on her shirt. Change is usually portrayed in a negative light. For many people, change is most unwanted. Think about it, what kind of person would want to have their life, which they have grown fond and accustomed to, be suddenly altered in a strange unfamiliar new way which forces them to adapt and understand so quickly? Yes, you can say that change can be for the better, but even if it does turn out to be for the better, one would still need to familiarise themselves all over again.

However, change is not simply straightforward. You can take one look at the changes of one's life and make a basic yes or no judgement on whether it was for the better or not, but to truly understand and decide if that change was for better or worse is a grand task. Changes can affect entire lives, not just one off events. Even then, it mightn't be either a better or worse change. There could be a mix of both kinds of change!

When it comes to changes in life, perhaps the most interesting change one can face is the kind which is being presented right now. In this story, is Hisao Nakai. An 18 year old boy native of Japan, he has lived his life in an orderly simply fashion for all of his years. That was until, he was faced with the unpredictable mistress of change. During a confession of love courtesy of his classmate Iwanako, a once dormant case of heart arrhythmia struck Hisao and almost dealt the schoolboy his final curtain call. Thankfully, the experience did not end his life there, but only went to drastically change it. Not one change, but several. The first being several long months of rehabilitation in hospital, which led right into his next major change in life, the change he is experiencing right now.

Hisao stands outside of the gates of Yamaku High School. While a change of school seems odd for a case such as his, take note that this is a school for the physically disabled. Hisao Nakai now forcibly wears the title of "Disabled Person", which has led him to abandon his old school and leave behind old friends, so he can join a new school that will suit the changes his life has been dealt. Having to spend the next years of his life here until he can pass his school years, the boy decides that first he must familiarise himself with his dorm room, where he and his possessions will reside for the years of this change.

It does not take him long to sort his room out. With his belongings unpacked and sorted, along with his newly acquired dosages of medication which he must take for the rest of his life, the Hisao lad plans to spend his time familiarising himself with the grounds of the school. With many facilities and areas all with their own purposes, it would pay for him to get to know where they were. Locking the dorm room behind him, he strolled into the school to take a look around.

From word of mouth, he was told of the library that Yamaku held. Being an avid reader for a long time and having his thirst for the written word enhanced by his time in hospital, he wanted to go there first to check out the state of affairs in the library. It wasn't too hard for him to find, being rather close to the main entrance of the school. Having located it, he swung open the doors and had a look inside.

Hisao could only marvel at the grand looking library. Rich brown wood was the basis of the room, shelves filled to the brim with books galore. The sections were completely stacked with literature, a visual feast for his eyes. He would expect this sort of library to be at a city hall or a court of law, not a school for the disabled. Moving foot after foot on the soft well kept carpet, Hisao walked onwards into the massive collection, getting a closer examination of the books before him.

Enjoying what he has seen so far, he then decided to turn some of the corners to see what lay deeper into the labyrinth of reading material. Bookcase after bookcase formed together to make passages, further spurring his curiosity to look onwards. However, as Hisao turned the very next corner, his eyes soon came across the sight. This sight was the figure of...

However, then he heard a sign they were close by. A faint chewing noise could be heard through the door of the last room on the upper floor, rustling of a bag could be heard too, no doubt used to carry the stolen goods. Silently stepping over, the knight swung the door open to meet the person inside.

15523111.content:
He opened the door with a rather large 'thunk,' which was a rather easy form of intimidation. Staring inside, the room itself was quite downtrodden, with broken windows and rotten floorboards. Glancing the room, the chewing noise ceased as he stepped in, his hand clutched onto his sword. In the corner of the room, he saw a rather interesting sight. It looked to be some sort of inky darkness, that rippled calmly with each passing second. Approaching this blob, he found another bag nearby and the scraps off food as well. As he went close enough, he noticed that this 'shadow' had a humanoid appearance.

"Hello?" asked the Knight in confusion as the mass turned around to reveal a half covered face. Getting a better look, the shadow appeared to be a female, and rather thin at that, with a torn cloth as her only source of clothing, The girl warily looked at Hisao, the part of her face visible going into a bit of a frown.

"W-Who are you?" asked the girl, slowly standing up to reveal her body. She did have legs and arms, but they were quite shadowy and the Knight didn't really know what to make of her.

"I am the Knight who protects this settlement. There have been reports of theft of food and I came here to investigate." said the knight, his voice filled with confidence. She grew a rather panicked expression on her face. It was a knight! Knights were always ruthless to criminals!

"Look, a thing over there!" she shouted as she pointed towards the other end of the room. The Knight looked towards where she pointed and the shadow girl took this as an opportunity to run out the room. It took the Knight a second to process what just happened and he took off after her. Finding himself in a hallway, he briefly saw the girl run into a room in the far side of the corridor. Running after her, he busted into the room, finding the girl huddled in a corner whimpering.

"P-Please, just leave me alone. I never hurt anyone, I don't want to die..." said the girl as she curled up into a ball on the ground. Realizing that he had not acted with delicacy, he realized what needed to be done. Dropping his sword on the ground, he slowly walked up to her.

"Calm down, I'm not here to hurt you." he said, She ignored him, still in her panicked state. Gently reaching out, he grabbed her hand gently, finding it to be solid. Looking at him, he could tell that the girl was completely innocent, aside from stealing all that food.

"Look, I'll explain everything to the townsfolk. I'll pay for the damages too. I promise, you'll be safe." he whispered gently. Taking in her words, she gently sat up and stared right at him, feeling rather calm.

"You promise?"

"Of course, you have my word as a knight."
15523111.title: In the Gloomy Darkness

A rumble of the stomach, seems she could use a proper meal
155231111.content:
Still feeling rather conflicted, the shadowy girl took a hold of the Knight's hand as he held hers, smiling slightly. "You won't...l-leave me, will you?..." She asked meekly, clutching onto his arm as he picked his sword back up to holster it into it's sheath.

Going to reply, the knight stopped. Was he going to leave her? He could easily sort out the incident and make sure she wouldn't get in trouble, but he had no idea if she would be okay. Looking at her, it was clear why she stole the food, the poor girl was painfully thin, with boney cheeks and stick like arms, the rags covering her body hanging from her tiny frame limply. He couldn't just leave her....but if he wanted the best for her, she'd need to....

"I promise, I will never leave your side. You can live with me from now on." The knight replied, smiling back at her. Suddenly, he found himself taken by surprise with a tight hug, surprising energy for such a thin girl.

Whilst they hugged, he felt the shadowy parts of the girl brush against his skin, feeling cold and soft. It was rather clear the girl wasn't normal by any means, but those eyewitness accounts he recalled from before about the girl gave him an idea on what she was like.

"I-If it's not too much trouble, can I disguise myself when we enter!" The shadow girl asked, the dark shadows of her left side slowly enveloping the rest of her body, squashing and contorting her frame into new shapes, until it formed into something new. The shadows disappeared, and now the girl looked completely different. She was now slightly smaller, with a healthy looking body and medium length black hair, darker than before. Wearing simple but warm clothes which fully fitted her, the girl smiled warmly. "Is this any good?" She asked in a new voice, a familiar voice.

The knight was stunned, even though he knew this girl had the ability to alter their appearance. More specifically, to change into the image of the loved ones of those around them. This person was by all means a loved one to him, the image of a young girl he knew long ago, back when he still lived in his home village and hadn't yet embarked on his quest. Seeing her face again, even if it was only an imitation, was something refreshing yet scary at the same time. However, he was brought back to reality by a certain detail.

Seems the shadow girl hadn't completely gotten the imitation right, as she had happened to give the knight's loved one a rather hefty chest, her breasts straining the fabrics of the top she wore. The real her he remembered was nothing like that, having a small modest cup size which was smart yet cute. The very idea of her having large breasts, let alone the incredible melons the imitation had, was a pretty laughable concept, but the knight stopped staring.

"You'll be all right, don't worry. Just be your true self, after all you're not a threat in the slightest." He replied. It was obvious why she asked the disguise, given the negative opinion on unnatural beings in human territory. Watching the girl morph back into her true form, he took hold of her hand again so to reassure her that everything would be okay.
